item.title: Galen add a quote by Tyrion Lannister
item.description: "There has never been a slave who did not choose to be a slave. Their choice may be between bondage and death, but the choice is always there." -- Tyrion Lannister

item.title: Galen add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Come away, O human child! To the waters and the wild With a faery, hand in hand, For the world's more full of weeping than you can understand." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Galen add a quote by W.B. Yeats
Galen add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "A sight to dream of, not to tell!" -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: Galen add a quote by William Blake
item.description:
"A DIVINE IMAGE
Cruelty has a human heart, And Jealousy a human face; Terror the human form divine, And Secresy the human dress.
The human dress is forged iron, The human form a fiery forge, The human face a furnace sealed, The human heart its hungry gorge." -- William Blake

item.title: Galen add a quote by Lewis Lapham
item.description: "Money is like fire, an element as little troubled by moralising as earth, air, and water. Men can employ it as a tool or they can dance around it as if it were the incarnation of a god . . . It acquires its meaning from the uses to which it is put." -- Lewis Lapham

item.title: Galen add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "There is strong shadow where there is much light." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Galen add a quote by Walter Goldscmidt
item.description: "The central importance of entering worlds other than our own lies in the fact that the experience leads us to understand that our own world is also a cultural construct. By experiencing other worlds, then, we see our own for what it is and are thereby enabled also to see fleetingly what the real world, the one between our own cultural construct and those other worlds, must in fact be like." -- Walter Goldscmidt

item.title: Galen add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "Dreams, books, are each a world; and books, we know, Are a substantial world, both pure and good: Round these, with tendrils strong as flesh and blood, Our pastime and our happiness will grow." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Galen add a quote by Aleksander Pushkin
item.description: "Better the illusions that exalt us than ten thousand truths." -- Aleksander Pushkin

item.title: Galen add a quote by Neil Postman
item.description: "Technopoly eliminates alternatives to itself in precisely the way that Aldous Huxley outlined in Brave New World. It does not make them illegal. It does not make them immoral. It does not even make them unpopular. It makes them invisible, and therefore irrelevant." -- Neil Postman

item.title: Galen add a quote by Sherry Turkle
item.description: "We ask [ of the computer ] not just about where we stand in nature, but about where we stand in the world of artefact. We search for a link between who we are and what we have made, between who we are and what we might create, between who we are and what, through our intimacy with our own creations, we might become." -- Sherry Turkle

item.title: Galen add a quote by Isaac Asimov
